reference.shortdesc:
The stepxmp element contains an example that illustrates how a step is completed. The example can be a few words, an image, or a paragraph.or a code block. Not sure the last sentence is necessary.
Kris Eberlein, 19 2022
A code block for tasks that are performed from the command line? (I often see people using <info> for that purpose …) FWIW, this short description has been in place since DITA 1.0.
Kris Eberlein, 20 October 2022
Talked to Dawn today. We discussed the short description – not sure if the best solution here is to code block to the second sentence or remove the second sentence. FWIW, we both agree this element is inconsistently used, and that each implementation needs to nail down how they will use it.
Kris Eberlein, 21 October 2022
Changed to read "The example might be text-based, an image, a code sample, a link to a video, or some other representation.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The stepxmp element is specialized from div. It is defined in the task module.

example.title: Example

div.p: We need a different example here, one that better illustrates ways that the element can be used.
I've added a real life example.

example.p: In the following code sample, the stepxmp element contains an example of what a user might type as a name for a widget:
example.codeblock: <step> <cmd>Type a name for the widget.</cmd> <stepxmp>For example, <userinput>mywidget</userinput></stepxmp> </step>
